Title: June 12: President, Nigerians differ on progress, impact 32 years after
Summary: June 12, 1993, historic election also pervaded the celebration of June 12 as Democracy Day yesterday . In a rather symbolic replay of fate, the same sombre suspense and apprehension, which defined the 1993 election, still pervades the celebration .

Title: International Day: Emergency services at risk over 80% blood shortage in hospitals
Summary: Emergency services at risk over 80% blood shortage in hospitals . Several blood banks nearly empty nationwide . Massive shortage of blood supply vis-à-vis national demand has put emergency services in dire straits .

Title: Democracy Day: Tinubu honours Alex Ibru, Kudirat, Nwosu, Akinyemi, others with national awards
Summary: President Bola Ahmed Tinubu has posthumously honoured the late Alex Ibru, publisher of The Guardian newspaper, with the title of Commander of the Order of the Niger (CON) in recognition of his pivotal role in Nigeria’s media and democratic evolution .

Title: South-East Governors Forum: Of what relevance to Ndigbo?
Summary: In 15 years of existence, the South-East Governors Forum (SEGF) has been widely regarded as ineffective in fulfilling the objectives that necessitated its establishment, and in a region in dire need of strategic leadership .

Title: SEC warns public against unregistered investment outfits
Summary: SEC warns public against unregistered investment outfits . CBEX (Crypto Bridge Exchange), operating under m ST Technologies International Ltd, remains banned from conducting any form of investment or financial services in Nigeria .

Title: Tinubu to Uncle Sam at 90: You’re an eminent statesman, journalism icon
Summary: President Bola Tinubu has showered encomium on the publisher of Vanguard media, Prince Sam Amuka-Pemu . He described him as an elder statesman and journalism icon .

Title: Police rescue 11 kidnapped victims in Katsina, arrest 2 kidnappers in Delta
Summary: Police intercepted a kidnapping gang in Katsina State . Following a gun duel, 11 kidnapped victims were rescued unhurt . Police also arrested 2 kidnappers in Delta .

Title: Democracy Day: Shun protests, embrace dialogue for peace – S-South youths urge Nigerians
Summary: South-South Youth Amalgamation has appealed to Nigerians to reject any street protest that could harm national unity and public peace . The group warned that if not properly managed, such protests could worsen Nigeria’s already fragile social and political balance .

Title: NRM to CJN: Halt court abuse by ‘failed’ politicians
Summary: The party made the appeal during a press conference held in Abuja on Thursday, coinciding with Nigeria’s Democracy Day celebrations . The National Rescue Movement (NRM) has called on the Chief Justice of Nigeria (CJN) to take urgent action .

Title: Israel strikes Iran’s nuclear, military targets in ‘Operation Rising Lion’
Summary: Israel has launched dozens of airstrikes on Iran’s nuclear and military targets, killing two Iranian top military generals . Its military said a ‘pre-emptive, precise, combined offensive based on high-quality intelligence’ had been launched – called Operation Rising Lion .

Title: Abia plans to buy back Star Paper Mill
Summary: Aba State Governor Alex Otti has made offers to buy back the moribund Star Paper Mill, Aba, and revive the industry . He announced this during a grand civic reception organised in his honour by the Abiriba Communal Improvement Union held at the Enyimba International Stadium .

Title: Police, others arrest 14, recover fake currencies in Jigawa
Summary: The police have announced a major breakthrough in Jigawa State, as joint security operatives conducted a successful raid on a criminal hideout in Digawa village, Birnin Kudu Local Government Area . The operation, which took place on June 12, 2025, the democracy day, resulted in the arrest of 14 male suspects and the recovery

Title: Ondo gov nominates ex-AAUA VC, 11 others as commissioners
Summary: The governor of Ondo State, Dr. Lucky Aiyedatiwa, has nominated 12 new commissioners for the state . The list includes Professor of Agricultural Economics, Igbekele Ajibefun, who was formerly Rector of the Rufus Giwa Polytechnic and Vice Chancellor of Adekunle Aj

Title: Kano Pillars FC technical adviser resigns
Summary: Kano Pillars Football Club has announced the resignation of its Technical Adviser, Usman Abdallah, with immediate effect . The club, in a statement on Thursday, said that Abdallah cited personal reasons for his decision to vacate the role . Abdallah was appointed shortly before the start of the 2024/2025 Nigeria Premier Football League

Title: Nigeria no longer true democracy, say Atiku, Obi
Summary: Atiku Abubakar and Peter Obi accuse Bola Tinubu of eroding the ideals of June 12 . They said the country could no longer be considered a functioning democracy under the present administration . Atiku said Nigerians were not experiencing true governance, but rather a form of domination .
